results.title: Beyond Rangoon
results.creator_credit: John Boorman, Eric Plestow, Barry Spikings and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: Patricia Arquette stars as American doctor Laura Bowman who flees to Burma on a package tour with her sister, Andy (Frances McDormand), following a family tragedy. Rather than achieve the peace and solitude she is desperately searching for, she encounters problems when the clash between peaceful protest and a militant government take an ugly turn. Andy flees the country, but Laura finds herself alone after being separated from her tour group, and without an identity after her passport is stolen at a political rally. She is befriended by a former professor (Aung Ko) who attempts to help her reach the Thailand border, and an allegory is drawn between a young woman’s plight to reach freedom and that of a nation facing political unrest. On their journey they witness firsthand the political struggle encountered by a group of dissidents. Cast also includes Spalding Gray and Victor Slezak.

results.title: Big (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Penny Marshall, James L. Brooks, Robert Greenhut, Gracie Films and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The wonderfully versatile Tom Hanks stars as Josh Baskin, a 12 year old who is transformed overnight into a 35 year old man when his wish to be ‘big’ comes true. Confused and frightened, Josh runs away to New York, where, by sheer luck, he lands the perfect job in a toy company. Suddenly he’s got freedom, money, toys and all the junk food he can eat. But he’s not prepared for what happens next when a sexy co-worker falls in love with him! Also stars Elizabeth Perkins and Robert Loggia.

results.title: Beyond kicks
results.creator_credit: Gary Toole, George Pearson, Michael McKennirey and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is about a group of young volunteers, the Free Youth Clinic, who run a ‘crisis bus’ to rescue young people experiencing bad drug trips, usually LSD. They pull up whenever the need arises and try to talk the person down. If the patient needs further medical aid, they know where to obtain it. The film shows some of the patients being interviewed after their rescue.

results.title: Bicentennial man
results.creator_credit: Chris Columbus, Michael Barnathan, Mark Radcliffe, Neal E. Miller, Gail Katz, Wolfgang Petersen, Radiant Productions, Laurence Mark Productions, 1492 Pictures, Touchstone Pictures and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Starring Robin Williams and Sam Neill, this is a futuristic tale set in the not so distant future when every home will have an NDR-114 robot - the latest technological advancement to serve man. This is the story of one NDR-114 robot, who came off the production line with a unique fault - he doesn’t want to be a robot, and his amazing 200-year journey to become human. Based on the short story and novel “The Positronic man” by Isaac Asimov.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Columbus, Michael Barnathan, Mark Radcliffe, Neal E. Miller, Gail Katz, Wolfgang Petersen, Radiant Productions, Laurence Mark Productions, 1492 Pictures, Touchstone Pictures and Columbia Pictures

results.title: Beyond hell's gate
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Peter Johnson, Film Australia, Nomad Films and Satonyx Films
results.brief_description: Three trailbike riders retrace the route that led 15,000 Chinese and 1,500 Europeans from Cooktown through Hell’s Gate to the Palmer Goldfields of Northern Queensland. Partly dramatised, it recounts the coming of the chinese, conflicts with the Aborigines and shows remnants of Maytown, the old mining settlement of Christie Palmerston, a legendary figure of the period.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Roberts, Peter Johnson, Film Australia, Nomad Films and Satonyx Films

results.title: Beyond therapy
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, Steven Haft, Sandcastle 5, Roger Berlind and New World Pictures
results.brief_description: Prudence (Julie Hagerty) is a conservative and slightly mixed-up young woman who thinks Bruce (Jeff Goldblum) is crazy. Bruce is crazy about Prudence, despite the fact that he is bisexual. Their therapists are no better off. Prudence’s therapist (Tom Conti) is more interested in scoring with his female patients than in treating their problems. Bruce’s therapist is as flighty as they come. Throw in Bruce’s jealous lover Bob (Christopher Guest), and his overly protective mother, and the scene is set for madness and mayhem. Adapted from his Broadway play by screenwriter Christopher Durang.

results.title: Beyond Everest (1980). Beyond Everest: the ongoing climb of Sherpa Hillary (2000)
results.creator_credit: Michael Dillon, Dick Smith Adventure and Michael Dillon Film Enterprises
results.brief_description: Conquering the mountain of Everest was not Sir Edmund Hillary’s only achievement in Nepal. Through a philanthropic enterprise he continued to fund development projects for the Nepalese people - projects that the people themselves requested. His legacy will live on through the children of Nepal attending one of the some 30 schools that his “Himalayan Trust” built since 1961 - in many cases by his own hands. This DVD contains two documentaries - one made in 1980 is about Sir Edmund at sixty years of age and the other made in 2000 continues the subject matter of his philanthropic work - the DVD release commemorates the 50th Anniversary of Sir Edmund Hillary’s ascent of Mount Everest.

results.title: Beyond the pack ice
results.brief_description: Describes life on the inhospitable Antarctic continent. Animal and plant life is sparse but man has established himself. At the Mawson research station intensive study programmes include auroral physics, meteorology and medicine. The four months of daylight are packed with outdoor activities. Shows the annual arrival of the supply ship from Australia and describes some of the emotions of the men on the expedition.

results.title: Between two wars: sunshine and eclipse (1927-1934)
results.creator_credit: William Weintraub, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Confident, prosperous Canada, expanding in all directions; then the stock market crash of 1929, its sequel the Great Depression, and a nation staggering with poverty and unemployment. But with it all, an optimistic outlook: bargains by mail order; extremes in women’s fashions; political see-sawing; hockey broadcasts by a very youthful Foster Hewitt; the word “quintuplets” in every headline.

results.title: Beyond the mind's eye
results.creator_credit: Michael Boydstun, Steven Churchill and Miramar
results.brief_description: Beyond the mind’s eye offers a compilation of computer animation from around the world. The emphasis is on psychodelic fantasy and “gee wiz” special effects, with original music by Jan Hammer. The viewer is taken on a surreal voyage that explores imaginative visions of a technological future, the outer reaches of the universe and alternate dimensions filled with colour and movement.
